Short Q: Is it worth to create a fresh install to run RP-1 on KSP 1.6.1 instead of still using 1.3.1? - I am especially interested in performance gains making the game run faster.

On the discord the answer was: " Lemme give ya a resounding YA "

A tiny bit off topic but I've been messing around with using RP-0 without Realism Overhaul, something I've been calling Less Real Than Real(ism).  It uses RSS with upsized and slightly adjusted stock parts, a subset of game play mods (Kerbal Construction Time, Kerbalism, etc) and a suitably hacked contract and tech tree. 

While still basically a prototype, it seems to work pretty well.  Progression matches the real world fairly well and I've been able to get it to model US, Soviet, and proposed/imagined missions in a 'less real' but still real-ish way.  This is definitely a light weight mod (by Realism/RP-0 standards anyway) with a much more 'Kerbal' feel; stock fuels, fewer parts, no procedural parts, etc.

I'm thinking of making it a real mod.  It's a big project to make it ready for prime time so I guess I'm just trying to gauge interest.  I would also want to get the blessing from the RP-0 devs since I would be stealing (with attribution of course!) a big chunk of their work.

So do you guys think there would be interest in something like this?

Is it possible to see what skyrockets Build Times and Launch Costs? I build a rocket which costs 423 funds and its Build Time is 925 d and 2341 Funds in Launch Costs - 5 times the actuall cost. I started a fresh game of RO/RP-1.

First of all your first rocket should be a simple WAC-Corporal with a build cost of 70-100 funds. Although I have to say that launch cost being almost 6x higher than the cost of the parts doesn't sound right at all. Might be something wrong with your install but there's not enough information to do better than guess. You do know about the tooling functionality in RP-1, right? If you haven't already then please also visit the wiki inside RP-1 GitHub repository. Recently a lot of content has been added that should be really helpful to a beginner.

Another topic: Does anyone of you already play with ROTanks? I wonder how to make large cylindrical tanks. As far as I tested, they only can be 1.5 times as high as wide (ignoring top or bottom modifications for now). In reality a shuttle tank is not made of several welded sections, isn't it?

Hey all, I am quite new but I have combed through forums for about 3 days now looking for an answer and I am just stuck. 

I have KSP version 1.2.2 and I get everything up and running for RP-0 except that B9 aerospace crashes the game on startup. I have installed everything except B9 and it runs, once I put B9 into the GameData folder (either via CKAN or manually) the game crashes before reaching the main splash screen. 

I dont think my computer is the issue, its got 16 gigs of RAM, an RX 5700 GPU and a Ryzen 7 2700 3.7 CPU.

Unfortunately I am mobile right now so I cant post any log files, but I will do so as soon as I get home. 

Does anyone have a possible fix in the meantime?

Thanks for the help, this community is awesome. I can only hope that Ill be as knowledgeable about the game and space flight as you all. (I teach math for a living and I thought I was pretty good at it, but you all have me smoked in that department!)

2 hours ago, KnedlikMCPE said:

Thanks for the notice, but i wonder why i downloaded 1.3.1 version.... Maybe i played 1.3.1?

The possibility that you might have a valid reason to use 1.3.1 was why i said you should probably be using 1.7.3.

If you really want to stay on 1.3.1 then you could download 7-zip.  https://www.7-zip.org/download.html .  That should be able to unpack the .zip.  But be aware that if you have other problems, you probably won't get any support from the RO/RP-1 devs beyond them saying use 1.7.3.  (I know that one of the RO devs has already said that the only supported version of RO atm is the version for 1.7.3).
